Based on the preferences and context provided, here are three movie recommendations:

1. "No Country for Old Men" (2007) directed by Quentin Tarantino. This neo-noir thriller follows a hunter named Ray who stumbles upon the aftermath of a drug deal gone wrong in Bruges, Belgium.

Starring: Josh Brolin, Elizabeth Berrington, Elizabeth Berrington, Anna Madeley, Anna Madeley, Eric Godon, Thekla Reuten, Jordan Prentice, Ralph Fiennes, Matt Smith.

2. "In Bruges" (2013) directed by Brendan Frasier. This neo-noir crime thriller follows two bank robbers named Rob and Holsten who are sent to Bruges, Belgium, a city known for its strict laws and violent crime rate, to carry out their bank robbery job.

Starring: Corey Johnson, Antonio Banderas, Radha Mitchell, Robert Forster, Morgan Freeman, Tom Hardy.

3. "Thick as Thieves" (N/ A) directed by Kevin Macdonald. This neo-noir crime thriller follows two bank robbers named Rob and Holsten who are sent to Bruges, Belgium, a city known for its strict laws and violent crime rate, to carry out their bank robbery job.

The Committee starts executing Tito's closest relatives and other people who are loyal to Tito. After some time, the Committee starts releasing Tito's closest relatives and other people who are loyal to Tito.
